dialogue.raw_text: I know he hasn't done real well against this guy, but I got a hunch he's due.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: striding in from the bullpen. He doesn't look relaxed. As he nears the infield he purposely doesn't look at Dorn. Dorn stares at him with undisguised venom. As Vaughan gets to the mound, he sees Patton getting his convict uniform on in the Yankee dugout. He looks away to see Haywood in the on-deck circle smiling out at him. Meanwhile, the CROWD has gone nuts at the sight of Vaughn. Bobby, Vic and Johnny are blasting out "Wild Thing" on the tom-toms and the whole stadium, 75,000 strong, is singing it. Doyle just pushes the mic forward and lets the crowd do it's work.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Vaughn nods, but we can tell he's too nervous to have digested any of that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Brown and Taylor leave Vaughn alone on the mound, the SINGING of the crowd ringing in his ears.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Okay, Ricky, Haywood likes the hard stuff in. Curve him on the hands, bust him away, and don't get up with anything. You listenin' to me Rick?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Patting him on the butt) O.K., kid, you're my man. Let's go get him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: C'mon Ricky, this guy is the out you been waitin' your whole life for.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: (INSERT STORYBOARD #216N)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No sooner has Taylor settled in behind the plate, than Dorn starts toward the mound. Vaughn watches him come with fear and trepidation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dorn arrives at the mound, and holds out his hand for the ball. Vaughn gives it to him. Dorn rubs it up, staring long and hard into Vaughn's eyes. Vaughn is sweating bullets. Finally Dorn speaks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He smiles and hands Vaughn the ball back. Vaughn returns the smile and accepts the ball. While Dorn trots back to his position, Vaughn turns his back to the plate for one last moment of concentration. As he turns around to face us, we see a new man as the wicked opening CHORDS of X's "Wild Thing" are heard on the TRACK, only louder and more savage than before. Vaughn steps up on the rubber, his face hardened into fierce resolve. There's nothing nervous about him now. This kid is gonna make somebody pay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Taylor sets down a sign. Two fingers for the curve ball. Vaughn shakes it off. Taylor puts down another sign. Vaughn shakes it off. Finally, Taylor puts down one finger -- the fast ball. Vaughn nods with steely purpose.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Vaughn winds and delivers a hissing blur toward the plate. Haywood takes a ferocious swing and misses. Strike one. We see the number 97 come up on the digital readout of the SPEED GUN which a club employee holds behind the screen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Taylor gets ready to flash another sign. The convict jumps up and down trying to distract Vaughn. No way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Taylor puts down one finger. Vaughn nods and then winds and fires again, another blazing rocket. Haywood takes a wicked rip, but doesn't get it. Strike two. 99 comes up on the gun. The convict has stopped jumpin'.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The fans are going wild. They're all standing now, yelling for a strikeout. Vaughn gets back up on the rubber with the look of an animal sighting prey. Taylor gets down to give the sign.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: .K. Vaughn has finished his warmup and we're ready to...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (seeing it) Oh, shit.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Let's cut through the crap. I only got one thing to say to you. Just rear back and strike this motherfucker out.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Haywood steps in, the American League triple crown winner. .341 average, 48 homers, 121 R.B.I.'s. He's homered the only two times he's faced Vaughn.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: All right, Ricky, let's get nasty.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Haywood) All right, looks like the boy is pumped. Sucker was movin', wasn't it? Ever hit ya, it'd leave a two foot hole comin' out.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (for Haywood's ears) Let's see, what should we call now. Let's see how he feels about old number one.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Nice swing, Haywood. Good follow- through. Keep it up, I'll show you the ball sometime.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: (INSERT STORYBOARD # 216R)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Taylor wiggles his fingers around and then puts down the big No. 1. Vaughn gives him a quick nod.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Vaughn goes into his windup and unleashes a screaming bullet toward the plate. Haywood pulls the trigger, but it's already by him. Strike three. 101 on the gun. Taylor leaps up and gives Vaughn the fist. The fans are going berserk. MUSIC ends.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Doyle turns the mike off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Monty takes a big swig straight from the bourbon bottle.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Forget the curveball. Go with the heater.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, shit, all these pitches to choose from. Maybe we'll try somethin' different this time.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And if I don't see you again, Haywood, have a nice winter. Okay, buddy?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Oh, Lordy, three straight heaters and the Yankees are blown down. No runs, two hits, three left on, and, are you ready, Cleveland? We go to the bottom of the ninth, still tied at two.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to his color man) Can you believe this, Monty?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Sequence omitted from original script.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: grounding out to short.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: walking up to the plate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Taylor and the others yell encouragement to Hayes as he digs in at the plate. The Yankee pitcher delivers and Hayes hits a high bouncer toward short. The shortstop waits for it to come down and then fires to first. Too late. Hayes streaks across the bag, beating the throw by a hair. Once again the CROWD comes to life. The Yankee Manager comes to the mound and waves for a new pitcher.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Out of the pen comes BILLY DUKE, a good facsimile of Goose Gossage only Duke is bigger and meaner. (INSERT STORYBOARD #219M)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Duke finishes his warmups and stares over at Hayes. Hayes smiles, snaps his black gloves out of his hip pocket, and carefully pulls them on over his hands. The Duke does not care for this kind of showmanship. Brown comes over to talk to Taylor, who's been watching Duke from the on-deck circle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Taylor starts for the plate, as Duke finishes his warmups. Brown comes down the dugout steps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pepper begins flashing signs out to Hayes. Duke gets up on the rubber and takes his stretch. Hayes leads away, crouching low. Duke snaps a throw over to first, the first baseman slapping a hard tag on Hayes, but Hayes is back. The crowd is on its feet again. The "GO" chant starts, punctuated by thousands of black-gloved hands punching the night air. Duke comes set again. Hayes leads away. Duke watches him, checks him again. We go to SLOW MOTION as Duke kicks and comes to the plate. Hayes takes off like a shot, head down, eating up ground. Taylor swings and misses. The Yankee catcher comes up throwing, rifling a clothesline dart to second base. Hayes leaves his feet diving for the bag. The second baseman snaps down the tag. Too late. Hayes is in there. The stadium is really rockin' now. Duke prowls the mound. Taylor steps out of the box and flashes a sign to Brown.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Brown flashes a sign out to Hayes. A hint of a smile comes over Hayes' face as he dusts himself off. Taylor steps back in as Duke gets up on the rubber. Taylor digs in his back foot, then points to the left field bleachers ala Babe Ruth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The crowd, electrified by Taylor's gesture, remains on its feet. Duke stares in at Taylor, comes to his stretch and then lets go a steaming fast ball right at Taylor's head. Taylor goes down in a swirl of dust, the ball missing him by inches. The stadium explodes with BOOS, but as soon as Taylor picks himself up, the crowd begins to ROAR again. Bobby, Vic and Johnny are pounding out a heavy beat on the TOM-TOMS. Everyone in the stadium begins to CLAP in unison with the DRUMS. Taylor steps back in and once again points to the bleachers.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Two down in the ninth, Hayes steps in hitting .291, trying to get something going for the Tribe.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) And Horton is wasting no time. He's goin' to the Duke.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Duke leads the league in saves, strikeouts per inning and nose hairs.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ya know I'd be an ass not to pinch- hit for you here. You're 0 for 18 against Duke. Plus you're beat to shit you can hardly walk, there's no way you can get around on this guy's fast ball. So I want the absolute truth here. Can you beat this guy?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeh.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Okay.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Pepper) Send Hayes the first pitch. I don't want Taylor takin' too many strikes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What's he doing?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Flashing some signals. That's a hell of an idea.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) What's this? Taylor is pointing to the bleachers, calling his shot.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) (Taylor points again) Unbelievable. They're on their feet here, stomping, clapping. C'mon, join in wherever you are out there. Let's hear you, Cleveland.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: and several of their friends at their bar, huddled around the RADIO with the punks and heavy metal kids we saw before. Slowly they begin to clap in time with the tom-toms which are audible on the T.V.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: at the opera with his wife, a radio earplug in his ear. His hand taps on his leg in sync with the TOM-TOMS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (Sc 222 before scene 221) beating on their shovels in the bullpen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: against the Cleveland skyline. In several of the lit windows we see people banging things or clapping.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Duke gets back on the hill. Getting the sign he wants, he comes to his stretch, checking Hayes at second. As Duke starts his delivery to the plate, we go to SLOW MOTION. The clapping in the stadium stops as everyone hushes to watch the pitch. We...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They've all stopped too in anticipation of the pitch.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: THE LONGSHOREMEN, THE BUSINESS EXECUTIVE, THE GROUNDSKEEPERS AND THE APARTMENT DWELLERS

direction.raw_text: Everything from here on will continue to be in SLOW MOTION. As Duke whips his arm toward the plate, Hayes takes off for third. Taylor, instead of swinging away, shortens up on the bat and bunts Duke's pitch down the third base line. The Yankee third baseman, caught completely unaware, charges the ball frantically.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: barreling down the line toward first on his sore legs, giving it everything he's got.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: scooping up the ball barehanded and firing on the run to first.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: pounding down the line. He strains for the bag as the Yankee first baseman stretches to his limit for the throw. Taylor and the ball arrive at almost the same time. Taylor hits the bag and then sprawls in the dirt as his knees give out. The umpire brings up his arms, and spreads them wide. Safe. Taylor's beaten it. The first baseman looks up to see something that strikes fear into his heart across the field. It's...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: streaking for home, trying to score all the way from second on a bunt. The first baseman fires to the plate, as the catcher positions himself for the throw. Hayes launches into a flying feet- first slide. The catcher brings the tag down. Hayes hooks to the outside, his trailing foot reaching for the plate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hayes' foot catches the corner of the plate. The umpire puts the palms down and whips them apart. It's all over, folks. SLOW MOTION ENDS DOYLE ...Safe. The Indians win it. The Indians win. Oh my God, the Indians win it!! Pandemonium breaks loose in Municipal Stadium. Rachel hugs Donovan, dances around, punches the air, then hugs Donovan again. Everywhere people are hugging and kissing each other. Bobby, Vic and Johnny are going berserk in the bleachers. Thelma sits quietly, a tear rolling down her cheek.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Hayes is gonna try to score! Here comes the throw. He slides. He is...
dialogue.name: dialogue
